definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]

sentences.english: By March 3, the average fare had dropped 8% to $312.
sentences.chinese: 到3月3日，均價下跌了8%，跌至312美元。
年營業收入下降17%跌至5億7千零6十萬美元。

sentences.english: But market freight rates had tumbled to under $20 a ton.
sentences.chinese: 而市場航運費率已經跌至不足每噸20美元。

sentences.english: Huang Guangyu, who founded Gome Electrical Appliances and owns unlisted property businesses, sank to 17th place from the top position he held last year.
sentences.chinese: 成立國美電器的黃光裕，已從首富跌至17名。

sentences.english: For baby boomers, these numbers drop to 50% and 44% respectively.
sentences.chinese: 在“嬰兒潮”人口中，數字分別跌至50%和44%。

sentences.english: The tumbling of the pound to 30-year lows offered a taste ofwhat is to come.
sentences.chinese: 英鎊匯率跌至30年來的低點似是山雨來臨前的風。

sentences.english: For the full year, it was down 14 percent to $11.2 billion.
sentences.chinese: 反觀全年，此項業務下跌14%，跌至112億美元。

sentences.english: The pound fell to a 23-year low against the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 英鎊兌美元匯率跌至23年低點。

sentences.english: The dollar is at a 15-year low against the yen.
sentences.chinese: 美元對日元匯率跌至15年來新低。

sentences.english: Finland, which topped the league for many years, has dropped to sixth.
sentences.chinese: 曾高居榜首多年的芬蘭跌至第六位。

sentences.english: Much of the United Kingdom has been enduring a heavy frost and sub-zero temperatures.
sentences.chinese: 英國大部分地區正經歷嚴寒，氣溫跌至零下。

definition: (of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
degree of reduction (in prices, numbers etc)/decline/drop
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
